sentences.en: A good debate can quicken one's mind.
sentences.cn: 有意义的辩论能使人的大脑更加敏锐.

sentences.en: Advances in design and production help quicken the process.
sentences.cn: 设计和生产的进步加速了这一进程.

sentences.en: Companies are finding it hard to cope with the quickening pace of technological change.
sentences.cn: 各家公司都发现科技的日新月异让他们难以应付。

sentences.en: Good debate can quicken one's mind.
sentences.cn: 好的辩论能使人头脑敏锐.

sentences.en: He quicken his pace, and took up new threads of talk.
sentences.cn: 他加快脚步, 找了些新的话题谈着.

sentences.en: I actually felt my heart quicken.
sentences.cn: 我感觉心跳真的加快了。

sentences.en: In the light purple brilliance and fragrance, I quicken unconsciously my step.
sentences.cn: 在这浅紫色的光辉和浅紫色的芳香中, 我不觉加快了脚步.

sentences.en: In view of the time limit , we have to quicken our pace.
sentences.cn: 考虑到问题的严重性,在事态进一步恶化之前, 必须采取有效的措施.

sentences.en: Odours, when sweet violets sicken , live within the sense they quicken.
sentences.cn: 甜蜜的紫罗兰已经开败,嗅觉中还留有它的芬芳.

sentences.en: P 2 P besides quicken, also can prevent dead link on certain level.
sentences.cn: P2P除了加速外, 也能在一定程度上防止死链接.

sentences.en: Ray glanced at his watch and quickened his pace (= began to walk faster ).
sentences.cn: 雷瞥了一眼手表，加快了步伐。

sentences.en: She felt her heartbeat quicken as he approached.
sentences.cn: 随着他的走近，她觉得自己的心跳加速了。

sentences.en: Something seemed to quicken her to a determination.
sentences.cn: 好象有什么事激动了她,使她打定了主意.

sentences.en: Suppose that we quicken the tempo of human life till men are senile at thirty.
sentences.cn: 假定我们就是要加速人生的速度,使得人满三十就衰老.

sentences.en: The order came back to quicken up the pace of advance.
sentences.cn: 有命令传回说要加快前进的步伐.

sentences.en: Unlike its competitors, Quicken had a simple user interface, and was fast and easy to install.
sentences.cn: 与其竞争对手不同, Quicken具有简易的用户界面, 而且安装快捷、简便.

sentences.en: Your heart beat will quicken when you run up the stairs.
sentences.cn: 跑上楼梯时,心跳会加速.

words.tran_cn: 快的；迅速的，敏捷的；灵敏的
加快；变活跃；进入胎动期

trans.tran_en: to become quicker or make something quicker
